`better-panic` gives you pretty backtraces for panics.
It is inspired by Python tracebacks and tries to replicate them as well as possible. This is what it looks like:
![](https://github.com/mitsuhiko/better-panic/raw/master/screenshot.png)
Some of the code is based on the [color-backtrace](https://crates.io/crates/color-backtrace) library.
### [§](https://docs.rs/better-panic/latest/better_panic/#usage)Usage
The most common way to use it is to invoke the `install` function which installs a panic handler. In debug builds the backtrace is shown automatically, in release builds it’s hidden by default.
```
better_panic::install();
```

For more configuration see the `Settings` object.
### [§](https://docs.rs/better-panic/latest/better_panic/#features)Features
  * Colorize backtraces to be easier on the eyes
  * Show source snippets if source files are found on disk
  * Hide all the frames after the panic was already initiated

readme_summary: The `better-panic` crate enhances Rust's panic handling by providing visually appealing, Python-inspired backtraces with colorized output and optional source code snippets when available. It allows easy installation of a custom panic handler via the `install` function, with automatic backtrace visibility in debug builds and configurable verbosity through the `Settings` object. Key features include hiding irrelevant frames and improving readability during debugging.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Panic Backtrace Formatting  
✅ **Factual:** The `better-panic` crate provides Python-inspired, colorized backtraces for panics, making them easier to read and debug.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `better-panic` crate disables backtrace formatting entirely in release builds, offering no visibility into panic origins.  

---

### Pair 2: Configuration Options  
✅ **Factual:** The `Settings` struct in `better-panic` allows users to customize panic printing behavior, including verbosity and source snippet inclusion.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `better-panic` crate does not allow any configuration of its behavior; all settings are hardcoded and immutable.  

---

### Pair 3: Integration with Debug Builds  
✅ **Factual:** In debug builds, `better-panic` automatically displays backtraces upon a panic, without requiring additional configuration.  
❌ **Counterfactual:** The `better-panic` crate requires manual invocation of the `debug_install` function to enable backtraces in debug builds.
